title: Bug 14943 - Incorrect Line Endings Generated by Code Assist
description: This bug report addresses the issue where Code Assist generates incorrect line endings for code on a Windows machine.
OB: When using Code Assist to create a for loop with a temporary variable, the resulting code contains LF (linefeeds) instead of the expected CRLF (carriage return + linefeed) line endings on a Windows machine.
EB: The expected behavior is that Code Assist generates code with CRLF line endings, conforming to the standard line endings for Windows.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new class.
2. Add a method.
3. Define a local variable for an array.
4. Use Code Assist to generate a for loop with a temporary variable. Observe the line endings in the generated code.
